zone.line: but much oftenor accused her
as having caused the deaths of h her
brothers & sister. Perpetual fretting
at last threw Mad. Martin into
a decline, which at first encreased
her irritability, but She is now at
rest for ever; for she did died
on the first approach of cold at
the beginning of this ‸ last winter that
has just passed. Justine has
returned to us and I assure you
I love her tenderly. She is very clever
and extremely mild & pretty and as
I mentioned before she is her air mein and
expressions are continually remind me
of my dear Aunt.
And I must say a few words to
you also, My dear Victor, of little darling
william. I wish you could see him. He
is very tall of his age with sweet laughing
blue eyes and dark eyelashes and curling
hair When he smiles two little dimples
appear on his cheeks which are rosy
with health - his chin comes down in
a beautiful oval a After this descrip
tion I can only say what our visitors
say a thousand times a day-'He is too
pretty for a boy'.X
Miss Mansfeld Now, dear Victor I dare
her
He has already
had one or two
little wives
but Louisa
is his favourite-
a pretty little
girl of five years old to
